message.text:
This was a long time ago,but I thought of sharing it.
I always feel glad when such activities are organised in a Place like  Nagpur which is closer to the city I live in.Nagpur is a tier 1 city and I never miss such opportunities closer by.
Metro cities like Mumbai, Bangalore,Delhi, Chennai have many such networking events, conferences but it takes time to travel to these places 
Everyone likes to attend in and near their city of living.Dont you?

Let's Participate.
It's great to be on the IAACD cover page,and if not it's great opportunity to get a chance to showcase your potential,learn from winning participant,and it's about the enthusiastic efforts to gain something new.

Attention  aspiring artists! The IAACD Cover Page Competition 2024 is now open, and the theme is "Beyond Smiles."

If your submission is selected, it will be featured on the cover of the esteemed journal, IAACD Esthetic Expressions. This is an incredible opportunity to showcase your talent .

To enter, simply send your esthetic picture to iaacdeditor@gmail.com. Don't delay - the competition is fierce, and the deadline is fast approaching. What are you waiting for? Submit your entry today and be part of something truly special.

##iaacdcoverpagecompetition

Work done in August 2017.A Composite Veneer on #11 and #21.
Almost completing seven years and going well.Composite Veneers can also provide a longetivity for years before they get ready for emax and other modalities

Sharing the work done in Jan 2022.Past these years,it's going well.
It's #11 with Ceramic Veneers having a lingual extension.
To my experience,I have come to know that in this area where the practice is located, people will not care too much about  shade matching as far as it just blends in ( acceptable enough)as much as they care about longetivity,and functionality.
They will consider you a better dentist if the restorations last longer and are functional enough to bite the food and no impaction or any related problems .
Yesterday I felt happy when one my patient who has had a mandibular four unit PFM bridge completed six years and the patient says," these are good enough"

My answer to this will be having skills, developing skills related to a particular needs of the job and developing knowledge based around it.
How about you

𝐒𝐤𝐢𝐥𝐥𝐬 𝐯𝐬. 𝐃𝐞𝐠𝐫𝐞𝐞𝐬 : 𝐀 𝐕𝐢𝐬𝐮𝐚𝐥 𝐌𝐞𝐭𝐚𝐩𝐡𝐨𝐫 

The attached image beautifully illustrates a point that's often debated in professional circles: the value of skills versus academic degrees. 🎓🆚🛠️

On one side, we see a rabbit effortlessly pulling a large carrot out of the ground -  a symbol of having practical skills. On the other side, another rabbit with a degree struggles with a much smaller carrot. This simple yet powerful imagery raises an important question: 𝑾𝒉𝒂𝒕 𝒘𝒆𝒊𝒈𝒉𝒔 𝒎𝒐𝒓𝒆 𝒊𝒏 𝒕𝒐𝒅𝒂𝒚'𝒔 𝒅𝒚𝒏𝒂𝒎𝒊𝒄 𝒘𝒐𝒓𝒌 𝒆𝒏𝒗𝒊𝒓𝒐𝒏𝒎𝒆𝒏𝒕, 𝒉𝒂𝒗𝒊𝒏𝒈 𝒑𝒓𝒂𝒄𝒕𝒊𝒄𝒂𝒍 𝒔𝒌𝒊𝒍𝒍𝒔 𝒐𝒓 𝒂𝒄𝒂𝒅𝒆𝒎𝒊𝒄 𝒄𝒓𝒆𝒅𝒆𝒏𝒕𝒊𝒂𝒍𝒔?

𝐖𝐡𝐢𝐥𝐞 𝐝𝐞𝐠𝐫𝐞𝐞𝐬 𝐜𝐚𝐧 𝐨𝐩𝐞𝐧 𝐝𝐨𝐨𝐫𝐬 𝐚𝐧𝐝 𝐩𝐫𝐨𝐯𝐢𝐝𝐞 𝐟𝐨𝐮𝐧𝐝𝐚𝐭𝐢𝐨𝐧𝐚𝐥 𝐤𝐧𝐨𝐰𝐥𝐞𝐝𝐠𝐞, 𝐬𝐤𝐢𝐥𝐥𝐬 - 𝐩𝐚𝐫𝐭𝐢𝐜𝐮𝐥𝐚𝐫𝐥𝐲 𝐭𝐡𝐨𝐬𝐞 𝐡𝐨𝐧𝐞𝐝 𝐭𝐡𝐫𝐨𝐮𝐠𝐡 𝐞𝐱𝐩𝐞𝐫𝐢𝐞𝐧𝐜𝐞 - 𝐝𝐫𝐢𝐯𝐞 𝐫𝐞𝐚𝐥-𝐰𝐨𝐫𝐥𝐝 𝐫𝐞𝐬𝐮𝐥𝐭𝐬 𝐚𝐧𝐝 𝐢𝐧𝐧𝐨𝐯𝐚𝐭𝐢𝐨𝐧.

In many industries, the ability to demonstrate what you can do often takes precedence over formal education credentials.

What do you think? Is the balance shifting between degrees and skills in your field?

#career #skills #professionaldevelopment #careergrowth #skillsvsdegrees #dducation #workplacetrends

📪📫📬 Please leave your constructive comments,your opinions,your ideas.
It's a kind of a poll and maybe while you are helping me,you are highlighting your opinion which needs a hearing.

The Question is......

Please consider fresher Dentist, Experienced dentists and Speciality faculty while suggesting.It will definitely help the entire community.

ingestedContentSummary.title: Indian woman who born and raised in Japan

message.text:
Indian upbringing in Japan.Happy to see how Indians are living the mixed culture.
Those who are raised only in India with no exposure of other countries may not have this experience.


https://lnkd.in/greniTFx

Extraction of the week.Quite a simple one.It was badly carious ,painful and Grade 3 mobile #17.Simple as it may look,it was slightly  difficult to remove in the end  as these curved roots are the reasons for it.
Once extracted I was examining that curved root which are a real menace for RCT.Its still not that curved,but that sent me into networking my longtime FB friend and Endodontist and one of the best ( Dr Sharvaree Deshpande)to provide me with the different files for these curved canals., recently having purchased the Endomotor for continuing rotary endodontics .Dr Sharvaree work with the curved canals  really enthused me and here's the list she provided.
" Hyflex CM files for curved canals"
"DPI flex CM files for normal canals"
"Cricdental files"
" Edge endo files"
And the best sealer as Bioceramic sealer.
I am not too much of an Endo enthusiast but I like to keep hands on with all aspects of dentistry.Its just that Orthodontics took my attention away and sudden digitalisation popped in as the future world of Dentistry,but I was reading a quote yesterday which made me think," Why worry about the past and the future,and drain the present.By draining the present you are losing everything.So concentrate on the present and focus as much as you can,as it will take care of the future."
One step at a time and digitalisation will follow.
Eyes seeing through the teeth.Something new

Did you know that some people can see with their tooth ? 
Well, this is not a joke , it is a process called Osteo-Odonto-Keratoprosthesis (OOKP) also known as “Tooth in Eye” Surgery, which is actually a surgery where an Ophthalmologist puts part of a tooth in the eye and it will help patients with corneal issues or disease to see! 
It was first performed in Singapore around 2003 . 
 Have you heard about this procedure before ?

ingestedContentSummary.title: What's it like living in Japan for Indians?

message.text:
Indians across the globe in many ways.
Everyone has got experiences good or bad.We all compare India with the country we are in,when it comes to cleanliness,order,how the local citizens follow the rules,ways of living and culture,working life,etc. There are some thing's that we really like and there are some things that we would like to discard.
If you ask me personally what is it that I would like to follow with my  experiences in Australia,my answer will be:-
1) It's the system of Australia that I liked,minus some of the misbehaviour of the locals who are uneducated,and on the Dole. System is being so kind to support the Dole to such people 
2)When I say system,I mean the cleanliness,the municipality that runs the big trucks to lift up the garbage,and the mowing that's done to make green lawns.
3) When I say system,I mean the trains that run on time,like if the train is at 8.10 am ,it will be at 8.10 am at the platform.How late it can get? As late as 8.11 am.The ticketing procedures are one on the train platform and also in the train or rather trams( The last I saw was in Nov 2013).Trams that run internally in the city area are an attraction.
4) When I say system,I mean the huge shopping centres  like huge malls and shopping 🛒🛍️ is DIY.The sensor installed at the entrance which makes a beep beep if any of the item is not paid.Every area will have one shopping mall.
5) When I say system,I mean the banks will have a queue method and no chaos,and no one can squeeze in between,and while the bank teller is talking to the customer ,the others in the queue cannot see your information.They are at a distance.
6) Traffic 🚦 at the roads is good.But then there are people who make mistakes,but rarely.The Parking rules are good and are given space and timings to park with a ticketing machine in the front.
7) When I say system, I mean drinking water is available 24/7.Hot water system is available 24/7.Cooking gas is supplied underground during the building of the house.The drains are underground.
8) When I say system,I like the dressing pattern at work meant for a particular industry.(Certainly the other lot try to wear clothes with too much of Hollywood type of show,which I did not like and I keep it out of my ways.Once upon a time I tried to follow it just to get on with the ways but really I hated it.)
9) When I say system,I mean the educated lot who are running the system to make it technologically efficient.Not the fully tattooed , 🌞 sun soaking sea side,and living on the Dole expanding in weight by a 90 kg,.
10) When I say system,I mean the fluent English that is spoken with clear accents,the women who were ambitious, working and not the ones carrying too many children in the pram with a Dole to support.

So here I am following what I liked.I like learning languages and let's talk of Japan.

I was browsing through the job section on Facebook and I came across this advertisement from Nexus Medodent.I have been reading the catalogue of Nexus Medodent for a while.
Posting this as I find it very skillful enough and is based in Mumbai 


Job Title: Dental Technology Specialist**

**Company:** Nexus Medodent 

**Location:**Mumbai 

**About Us:**
Welcome to Nexus Medodent (NMD) where innovation meets affordability in the dental materials industry. With over a decade of experience, we have established ourselves as a leading provider of cutting-edge dental solutions, proudly based in India and serving clients worldwide.

**Job Description:**
We are seeking a skilled and experienced dentist to join our team as a Dental Technology Specialist. In this role, you will be responsible for operating our 3D scanner and 3D printer, as well as providing training and assistance with the installation of dental technology equipment. Additionally, proficiency in Exocad software is required.

**Responsibilities:**
- Operate 3D scanner and 3D printer to produce accurate dental models and restorations.
- Provide training and support to dental team members on the use of dental technology equipment.
- Assist with the installation and setup of new dental technology systems.
- Utilize Exocad software to design and customize dental restorations.
- Maintain accurate records of equipment usage and maintenance.

**Requirements:**
- Degree in Dentistry from an accredited institution.
- Proven experience operating 3D scanners and 3D printers in a dental setting.
- Proficiency in Exocad software for dental design.
- Strong attention to detail and ability to produce high-quality dental restorations.
- Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
- Ability to work well both independently and as part of a team.

**How to Apply:**
Please submit your resume and a cover letter outlining your relevant experience and why you are the ideal candidate for this position to [princeshah@hotmail.com]. 
What’s App #- 9769193360 
We look forward to hearing from you!

**Application Deadline:**
30.05.2024

message.text:
Dr Amr Asker runs a full house Orthodontic courses from Basic to Advanced for Dentists.And many have benefitted from him.I think he was also invited to the University of Sharjah recently.
He explains very precisely the clinical concepts of the normally found clinical cases and is very clinical oriented on FB as well.
These are some of the ideas that I think should get a startup in India.


https://lnkd.in/g7enEK8H

One of the best read from Dr Martin Baxmann for "Aligners".
Aligners are the modern trend but what does Dr Martin say about In house Aligners.I have seen him online conducting a lot of courses for Dentists.
Enlightening ideas.

What happened to the in-house aligner trend?

The last two decades have been a testament to major technological breakthroughs in orthodontic treatment, a niche that has been allowed to completely mature only in recent years. Various companies have and continue to pump out products that closely listen to the patient’s concerns and demands. Clear aligners are at the forefront of orthodontics’ modern-day renaissance. 

Today, we have been experiencing a flood of clear aligners in the market all of which have been advertised to be popular and much less noticeable options for teeth straightening. Clear aligner manufacturers are churning out more software updates, state-of-the-art technological accessories, and newer biomaterials that have further solidified the place of clear aligner systems in orthodontic practice.

Orthodontics is now a broad-encompassing field with function and form no longer being the most valued by customers. Today, getting an orthodontic treatment has as much to do with restoring the functional capabilities of the patient as it does with augmenting the aesthetics of the patient’s smile.

Continue reading:
Something out of the box but may benefit the community at large and has  got to do with education and interests

This kid hails from a small town in Kerala.

He had limited exposure and means in middle school but he was curious.

He reached out to people for mentorship and became one of the first pilot kids for our career discovery program when he was in grade 9.

Post our sessions, he felt interested in Management Consulting and decided to study Economics and Business.

Next, he had won Global Citizen Scholarship to pursue his Class 11th and 12th for free at GIIS Singapore (one of the most reputed international IB schools in the world).

Now, he wants to pursue a global career in Consulting & Finance and applied to programs which offer best exposure but are also affordable for his family.

I'm proud to see he has cracked fabulous business programs in both US and EU and is now heading to super prestigious joint business program offered by USC Marshall School of Business, Bocconi University Milan and HKUST! 🇺🇸 🇭🇰 🇮🇹 

We often subconsciously nudge our kids to pursue what we feel comfortable with. This kid would have never known about Management Consulting at home. 
This is why career discovery is important so that one can choose the subjects and streams more appropriately.

What I am loving about our work at 24NorthStar - Indian children are going beyond the textbooks and entrance exams. Excited to build the community of students who are aiming high and conquering new peaks.

Future is bright 🇮🇳

Relapse in Orthodontics
A commonly faced fear.It may happen,or it may not happen.
In dentistry such kind of relapse happen with RCT as well.Dentures may become unretentive with time,a properly scaled mouth may start getting plaque,a composite filling may get dislodged,a crown may get dislodged etc.
So in Orthodontics if such facts are explained in brief it is a thing that can be dealt properly.

"Essix with Tongue Spikes" 
Tongue thrusting, where the tongue pushes against the teeth during swallowing or at rest, often leads to the relapse of orthodontic treatment. Addressing this issue typically involves using removable habit-breaking appliances, but these can be uncomfortable and unsightly, resulting in poor patient compliance. The appliance here serves a more aesthetic and comfortable option for patients needing habit control for tongue thrusting and retention of treatment results.  Its dual functionality allows it to serve as both a retainer, maintaining teeth alignment post-treatment, and a trainer, guiding the tongue to a proper position. This innovative solution enhances the effectiveness of orthodontic care by addressing the underlying cause of tongue thrusting while providing a more user-friendly experience, thereby reducing the likelihood of treatment relapse.

I had an interesting conversation with my LinkedIn network Dentist, regarding this place.We laughed at the point where I could not remember where the place was as I had seen it thirty years back or so.
Pondering over this topic a thought entered my mind and I tried to compare it with our Dental Profession.
This place is Triveni Sangam ( Confluence of three rivers- Ganga,Yamuna and Saraswati).It so happens that the two major rivers collide with each other but the third escapes the total visibility and remains unseen.
By looking at the picture  you can tell the difference in between the two.One looks with clean water but the other side it's a bit polluted and when the confluence happens the cleanliness of the blue 🔵 colour vanished totally or is indistinguishable.
Such is the state of our mind too.( From being peaceful to jealous, inferiority complex,hatred, etc in its polluted form)

This might seem a bit controversial,but some have preferences over it,and it flows this way:-
Clinical work( one river,) is what we learn in our school days and basically we are trying to establish in our clinical work .We want to be on the clinical side as we graduated with it.But when clinical jobs are not in abundance,dentists may to forced to form a confluence with another river and that is nonclinical.Now if the nonclinical takes over completely,you will not be called a clinical expert but a nonclinical one.
Now if the nonclinical excels in everything and if you are happy with it,you will be in an excellent state of mind or you will have missed your clinical role as well.There will be times when you don't have a choice and may disappear doing another job and not seen in Dentistry like the Saraswati.

Does it make sense? But it does happen
So beware of migrating into different sites.First make a choice and be fully prepared.No one wants to go in circles.

I really liked this kind of an arrangement and I had this in my mind for a long time.
It provides the freedom to be on the move and reach out to places where attention to oral health is essential

Recently I had a very interesting discussion on LinkedIn with my network Dentist where the previously treated case with expansion was given a transpalatal arch with the arms extending till the canines.It was a 10 year old patient .The E was present on both the sides with the central incisor trying to block out anteriorly due to space problem.

We normally have this question what age group will be right to start the treatment, immediately when they are noticed,wait and watch,study the exfoliating and eruption time difference,or are they self correcting( like the ugly duckling  stage),etc etc 

Today I fortunately found a post that takes into consideration age group while noting such a malocclusion .

Just sharing the picture of it.
